Text.Value: This land needs you and Thaniel together, Oliver. Nature needs you.
You did better than most though, so I'll let you go. Here - second prize. You'll need it.
I'm Oliver. I'm seven.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Oliver] recoils from the PLYR, then 'poofs' away. (SCL_OliversDiary_Oliver_Vanishes) <LoganP>
EditorData.SFXTags: Transforming wind as Oliver turns invisible
EditorData.VFXTags: Oliver begins to become invisible and disappear... possibly with shadow mist

Text.Value: Not back to gloat, are you? Nobody likes a bad winner.
They don't need names. They just need to be mummy and daddy, and do what I want. Now play with me, or they'll be angry with you.
Let's play another game - I deserve a chance to even the score.
No - leave me alone!

EditorData.NodeContext: On alert - sensing the player means him harm

Text.Value: Have you seen another little boy around here? He's called Thaniel - he's very special.
I don't have time for this.
Another presence lingers near the boy. Study him, try to discern what it is.
I have a mummy, a daddy, and a doggy. They'll be back in a while. But you're here now. And I want to play.
I still think you might have tricked me. If you did - I'll figure it out.
I think we're done here.
I win! I win!
Will you play with me?
*Below the layers of shadow and curse, you sneak a fleeting glance of this creature's true nature.*
*Though shrouded in shadows, the child's resemblance to Thaniel is unmistakable. This must be his dark half - warped by the curse.*
Like it or not, you don't belong here.
Go on. Find someone else to play with.
Don't startle people like that - easy way to wind up killed by mistake.
Boo! I scared you - I saw it. Nobody beats me at hide and seek.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player turns their head left and right, sensing something. Oliver jumps up from bottom of frame, trying to jumpscare the player.

Text.Value: I won fair and square. There's no point in playing again - I want a challenge.
I don't know anyone called that. Don't ask me again.

EditorData.NodeContext: distressed - a memory is stirring that you're trying to supress

Text.Value: Study the boy. Try to understand his true nature.
*Something is amiss about the boy - but exactly what eludes you.*
A familiar magic exudes from this boy. Try to commune with it.
*Unlike your patron, the presence isn't seperate. It's more part of the boy. You focus your gaze on him.*
No, I'm finished.
Fled back to the shadows, no doubt. Come out, boy, or this mean old Harper might get cranky.

EditorData.NodeContext: Weary sigh, second line calling out to the darkness at a cursed child who's growing tiresome

Text.Value: *Too many layers of shadow and curse obscure the familiar, latent magic of the child.*
I can play you a little song  - would you like that?
What are your parents' names? Maybe I can find them.
I'm not going anywhere. I like it here. Now play with me, or else.
*The boy doesn't like these questions - because he has no real answers. And perhaps no real family.*
And if I don't find you?
No!

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Shadow family appears and  combat ensues
EditorData.SFXTags: Transforming wind as Oliver turns invisible
EditorData.VFXTags: Oliver begins to become invisible and disappear... possibly with shadow mist

Text.Value: You want to play? Fine.
I've changed my mind. You're on your own.
*Not an ordinary child, but not a spectre either. One part of a greater whole. Something ancient. And oddly... sad?*
You're not my mummy - don't tell me what to do.
You're not my daddy - don't tell me what to do.
You're not my mummy or my daddy - don't tell me what to do.
I think we're finished here.
Go on - leave me alone!
You weren't supposed to find me. You weren't supposed to win.

EditorData.NodeContext: More confused than angry, like the impossible has happened.

Text.Value: That little bastard - where'd he go?

EditorData.NodeContext: Not too mean, in a jaunty way (talking about a kid)

Text.Value: Try to find me again - but my family will be looking for you at the same time, so don't get caught!

EditorData.SFXTags: Transforming wind as Oliver turns invisible
EditorData.VFXTags: Oliver begins to become invisible and disappear... possibly with shadow mist

Text.Value: I don't know what you mean. I'm just me. I have a mummy, a daddy, a pet doggy.
Back to the shadows. After him, ra'stil - we need to see this through.
Not harder - impossible.
You were too good for me.
He's gone - and we need to follow. He'll feel the safest where the shadows are deepest.
I know.
I know who you really are, and where you really belong. You need to reunite with Thaniel.
Don't you have anyone else to play with?
We're not finished!

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Shadow family appears after the dialogue and combat ensues
EditorData.SFXTags: Transforming wind as Oliver turns invisible
EditorData.VFXTags: Oliver begins to become invisible and disappear... possibly with shadow mist

Text.Value: Make time. I want to play. Or else.
Leave.
Leave.
Now play with me.
Don't be a sore loser.
Don't make this harder than it needs to be.
Who are you?
That's him - like an echo of Thaniel, remoulded by the curse. We need him, if we're to put a stop to all of this.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Halsin whispers, trying to not alert Oliver
EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent, determined. Whispered, so not to alert Oliver.

Text.Value: All right. I'll hide, and you seek.
The child's ki feels... uneven. At odds. Why?
Yes I do. You can't make me do anything.
We're done here.
You ruined my fun - I don't want to talk to you.
I'm not going back. I like it here - I've made a family for myself, I get to play all the time.
Killed? Nobody dies around here, silly. Not like that. Play with me, and you'll see for yourself.
Sorry, I don't think they're coming back. Want to come to my camp?
Hmph. You're good at this - are you sure you didn't cheat?
I don't know what you mean. The shadows must be making your head go funny.
I'm Oliver. I'm seven. Will you play with me?
In a moment maybe. Have you seen another little boy? His name is Thaniel.
Play? This is no place for a child - if that's even what you are.
*Wherever Oliver has fled to, you have to pursue him. No doubt he will seek a place where the shadows are strongest.*
He's scarpered. We'd better track him down - if the shadows don't stop us first.
No!
We're done when I say we're done.
You're quite clearly a magical anomaly, child. What's really going on here?
You're not what you say you are. I can sense it.
Spoilsport.
Let's play again - you might be able to even the score.
He's scarpered - and I suppose it's up to us to find him.
Find me, and you win.
Then you lose.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smallest hint of menace laced into an innocent-seeming statement.

Text.Value: Let's play.
I don't want to play with you anymore.
No - go away!

EditorData.NodeContext: On alert - sensing the player means him harm

Text.Value: We're done here.
Of course I am! Now are you going to play with me or not?
You shouldn't be nasty. You should just do what I want. It's easier for you, that way.
Lunge at him.
Good idea - you're smarter than some playmates I've had. They always tried to leave before I was done with them.
We're finished when I say we're finished.
Let's play again.
Slippery little bugger, isn't he? He'll be looking for somewhere safe - somewhere where the shadows are nice and strong.
All right. Let's begin.
You're quite clearly a magical anomaly, child. What's really going on here?
You're no ordinary little boy, are you? I can sense it.
But I can't let you think me a bad sport. Here's your prize. You'll need it.
Face facts, kid. Your family's dead - and you might be too.
I win! I always win, in the end.
He's not special - he's nothing. You shouldn't say that name. Forget you ever heard it.
Get ready - and no cheating.

EditorData.SFXTags: Transforming wind as Oliver turns invisible
EditorData.VFXTags: Oliver begins to become invisible and disappear... possibly with shadow mist

Text.Value: He's fled - we need to track him down. Wherever the curse is strongest, that's where he'll go. That's where he'll feel safe.
Not that kind of playing, silly - I want to play a game! It'll be really fun, let me show you.
A child? Here? Must be magical - but how? Study the boy.
Unsual magic pours from the creature. What is it?
Let's make this quick. We need to reunite him with Thaniel.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Halsin whispers, trying to not alert Oliver

Text.Value: You can't make me do anything I don't want to. I won't let you.

Synopsis: Dialog with Oliver, the shadow-child in the Shadowcursed Lands. Oliver wishes for the player to be his playmate, and engages in a game of hide and seek. Oliver seems to be a soul trapped by the curse for a 100 years, but the player will gradually realise over the course of the act that he is in fact a shadow version of Thaniel, the spirit of the land. Oliver possesses Thaniel's heart, and the curse cannot be lifted until it is returned. Oliver does not want to do this - he's made his own little 'family' using cursed beings in the area. If the player challenges him about Thaniel, Oliver will flee towards the town square, where a final confrontation will take place.
